scripts.test: npm run test:unit && npm run test:e2e:headless
scripts.android:copy: npm run native:build && npx cap copy android
scripts.android:copy:release: npm run native:build && npx cap copy android
scripts.android:open: npm run android:copy && npx cap open android
scripts.ios:copy: npm run native:build && npx cap copy ios
scripts.ios:copy:release: npm run native:build && npx cap copy ios
scripts.ios:open: npm run ios:copy && npx cap open ios
scripts.electron:copy: npm run native:build && npx cap copy @capacitor-community/electron
scripts.electron:copy:release: npm run native:build && npx cap copy @capacitor-community/electron
scripts.electron:open: npm run electron:copy && npx cap open @capacitor-community/electron
scripts.electron:release: npm run electron:copy:release && cd electron && npm run electron:release
scripts.electron:release:sodium: npm run electron:copy:release && cd electron && npm run electron:release:sodium

engines.//: We don't want to use node >= 18.13 because they've made some breaking changes on the Date formating.
And that break our unit test. We better correct them when we bump the version of node that is compatible on all platform (web included)
